snippet: Julian Assange, the WikiLeaks founder, lost his last chance in Britain to appeal a ruling ordering his extradition to Sweden to face allegations of sexual abuse.
abstract: Britain’s Supreme Court rejects a final move by the founder of WikiLeaks, Julian Assange, to reopen his appeal of a ruling ordering him extradited to Sweden to face allegations of sexual abuse and rape; court also rules that he must be extradited by midnight on July 7, barring further legal intervention.
lead_paragraph: Julian Assange, the WikiLeaks founder, lost his last chance in Britain to appeal a ruling ordering his extradition to Sweden to face allegations of sexual abuse.

headline.seo: British Supreme Court Clears Way for Assange Extradition
headline.main: WikiLeaks Founder Loses in Court Again
headline.print_headline: WikiLeaks Founder Loses in Court Again
